Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2013 03:48PM livrn wrote: Liefie and chrissyb, thank you so much for answering!  This has me pretty nervous.   Just called my gyn office and have an appt for 10/14 at 0830.  Just nervous.  This pain has been going on for 3 weeks and I have been wearing one regular bra with 2 jogging bra for about 2 months as my size has changed somewhat rapidly.  Am really hoping that this is benign.  Even though I am an RN, I work with older men and do not have a lot of knowledge on women's health.
Posts.Title: pain from weight loss?? livrn liefie

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2013 11:20AM - edited Oct 9, 2013 11:27AM by livrn Also a second question that stems from the first. I have my appt next monday. Trying not to be too scared. Last thursday when I took my bra off my husband said that it looked like I had a welt over the left nipple. This went away within 2 hours. My husband believes that the pain I am having is coming from this bra being too small. However it is only on the left nipple and the pain still persists today and I have not wore that bra since last Thursday. So, I guess I am wondering if wearing an ill fitted bra for 5 weeks can cause persistant pain even the situation is remedied. My husband also thinks that this is happening on the left side only because that breast is a little bit larger. I don't know. Any ideas?
Posts.Title: pain from weight loss?? livrn liefie

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2013 03:28PM - edited Oct 17, 2013 03:29PM by livrn Went to gyn doctor Monday. Physician states that she feels something firm in the concerned area, but not an actual mass. Doc asked about breast cancer family hx. Positive for 2 post menopausal- maternal grandmother and paternal great-aunt. Doctor scheduled a mammogram with ultrasound if needed on 10/28/2013. I am also seeing a plastic surgeon in December for a breast reduction consult so I know I need to have a mammogram anyway before having a breast reduction.

Posts.Content: livrn wrote: Over the last 6 months I have lost approx 25 pounds, have went from 160 to 135.  My bra size has went from a 36H to a 34DD.  I am only 5'3 and my target weight is approx 120.  However since I have lost this weight my breasts look saggy, but worse still the left one (the nipple and directly below) are very sore, even painful-when touched, bumped, or without a bra.  Scared...  Is this breast cancer?  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2013 11:31AM livrn wrote: Had my mammogram yesterday. Radiologist said that everything looked good and that she did not see a need for ultrasound. She states that the area that is painful shows up fatty and that there is nothing there at all. She suggested that I give it more time, but does not feel that it is cancer. Thank you for all for being so kind!
